page.title: 02Local History
page.content: Kirkpatrick Fleming village is named after the Church, dedicated to St. Patrick around 1190. The present Kirk was built in 1733, and renovated in 1892. Seven defensive peel-towers were built by the Irving clan along the Kirtle Water, at Kirkconnel, Blackethouse, Bonshaw, Woodhouse, Robgill, Stapleton and Cove. Bonshaw Tower was the finest and earliest, built originally around 1100.It was clan home of the Irvings, and the old clan bell still remains to summon the clan in times of danger.Near the ruin of Cove House is the cave, made by prehistoric men standing on a long-melted ledge of ice, where King Robert the Bruce traditionally hid and saw the spider before Bannockburn.
